content:
Hello, for commenting code, how descriptive do we need to be/how many comments per section are typical? I tried looking at the style guide, but is there a more thorough example of comments in code that you'd recommend as a good reference?

Thanks so much!
subject: Commenting Code

content:
As long as the comments help you or someone else understand your code, there are no wrong answers. Style won't be graded on the first checkoff, so it's a great opportunity to get feedback from an LA/TA on your commenting style. For the first pset, aim for over-commenting rather than under!

Here's some code that checks if a number is even or odd, with how I might comment it:

num = input('Input a number: ')
if num % 2 == 0:  # Check if num is even
    print('Your number is even!')
else:  # Otherwise, num must be odd
    print('Your number is odd!')
Do we have to do duplicate comments if parts of the code are the same in different parts of the pset (ex: part a and b)
It wouldn't hurt! Especially since they are in two different files (the rationale being that if someone opened up either independently, they might still want to know what the code means!)
